required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prevalence of Kidney Disease, Hemodynamic Predictors and Long-Term Renal Outcome in Pulmonary Hypertension
clinical_study.official_title: Prevalence of Kidney Disease, Hemodynamic Predictors and Long-Term Renal Outcome in Pulmonary Hypertension - A Single Centre, Retrospective Analysis

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluation of the prevalence of kidney disease, hemodynamic predictors and long-term renal outcome in patients with pulmonary hypertension.

detailed_description.textblock: This study aims to determine the prevalence of kidney disease, hemodynamic predictors during right heart catheterization and long-term renal outcome in patients with pulmonary hypertension.

primary_outcome.measure: Classification of hemodynamic parameters measured at time-point of right heart catheterization according to kidney function stages 1-5.
Mortality of patients with pulmonary hypertension during follow-up period based on kidney function stages 1-5 measured at time-point of right heart catheterization.
Estimated GFR decline in each class of pulmonary hypertension during follow-up period
Predictive value of central venous pressure and b-type natriuretic peptide at time of right heart catheterization for development of chronic kidney disease.

secondary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of diuretics in patients with pulmonary hypertension at time of right heart catheterization.

biospec_descr.textblock: Collection of only residual material (blood, urine) for Deutsche Zentrum f√ºr Lungenforschung Biobank.

study_pop.textblock: All patients with diagnosed PH undergoing right heart catheterization between 1999 and 2013

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Older than 18 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with estimated GFR < 15ml/min or with chronic dialysis treatment

overall_official.affiliation: University Clinic Giessen and Marburg - Campus Giessen, Department of Internal Medicine II, Division of Pulmonology, Nephrology and Critical Care Medicine

facility.name: University Clinic Giessen and Marburg - Campus Giessen

results_reference.citation: Navaneethan SD, Wehbe E, Heresi GA, Gaur V, Minai OA, Arrigain S, Nally JV Jr, Schold JD, Rahman M, Dweik RA. Presence and outcomes of kidney disease in patients with pulmonary hypertension. Clin J Am Soc Nephrol. 2014 May;9(5):855-63. doi: 10.2215/CJN.10191013. Epub 2014 Feb 27.
Husain-Syed F, Slutsky AS, Ronco C. Lung-Kidney Cross-Talk in the Critically Ill Patient. Am J Respir Crit Care Med. 2016 Aug 15;194(4):402-14. doi: 10.1164/rccm.201602-0420CP. Review.
